alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 03 at 2:43PM MDT until April 04 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches for lower elevations and 12 to 18 inches for mountains. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Bighorn Mountains Southeast, Northeast Johnson County and Southeast Johnson County. * WHEN...Until 6 PM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult tonight and Tuesday morning. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...While snow may begin across far southern Johnson County this afternoon, the heaviest snow and strongest wind are expected from this evening through midday Tuesday. The heaviest snow is likely to fall in the southern Bighorn Range over far southern Johnson County near the Natrona County line.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County
